channel.title: How do i add lunar altar?
channel.description: how do i add a lunar altar im using project sanity base server. when i try add the object id and the position it doesnt go there after i compile. can somebody help me on teamviewer or something add me on burnleyladz@hotmail.co.uk i want the position to be at character-posx = 3104, character-posy = 3508. i will give rsbot with scripts and co-owner of my server or admin.

item.source: How do i add lunar altar?

item.title: How do i add lunar altar?
item.dc:creator: @deathscapepkz deathscapepkz
item.description:
@deathscapepkz wrote:

[quote=“DivineSouls, post:2, topic:365837”]Again, just do what I told you before

If you are using the Project Insanity Source search for objectmanager.java in your source files. Once you open that, search for loadCustomSpawns. You will see a list again. Add this to that list:

c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(410, 3104, 3508, 0, 10); // Lunar Altar
What it means:
c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(Object ID, X Coordinate, Y Coordinate, Facing Position, Don’t worry about this); // Lunar Altar[/quote]

you never said “before” and it doesnt work i also recompiled it?

Read full topic
item.source: How do i add lunar altar?

item.title: How do i add lunar altar?
item.dc:creator: @DivineSouls DivineSouls
item.description:
@DivineSouls wrote:

Again, just do what I told you before

If you are using the Project Insanity Source search for objectmanager.java in your source files. Once you open that, search for loadCustomSpawns. You will see a list again. Add this to that list:

c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(410, 3104, 3508, 0, 10); // Lunar Altar
What it means:
c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(Object ID, X Coordinate, Y Coordinate, Facing Position, Don’t worry about this); // Lunar Altar
